register.description: Configuration Register for Queue 'y' Offset = 8000h + (y * 8h); where y = 0h to 4h

bitfield.description: This is the number of commands that will be sent by other queues before allowing the queue to arbitrate again for the right to send commands. This is only started when a queue exhausted its consecutive trans count.

This is the number of consecutive transactions that will be sent before allowing another queue of equal level to arbitrate to send commands. This is the maximum number of commands that it can send. If the queue has any delays such as virtual address lookup then the arbitration will be forced regardless of the number of commands.
This configures the QoS for Queue 'y'. This should only be set for fixed priority queues and the lower queue should have the lower QoS.
This configures the Order ID for Queue 'y'.
This configures the priority for Queue 'y'. This will be the priority that will be presented on the External bus for all commands from this queue.

register.description: Status Register for Queue 'y' Offset = 8040h + (y * 8h); where y = 0h to 4h

bitfield.description: This is the channel that the read half is currently working on.
This is the channel that the read half is currently working on.
This is the channel that the write half is currently working on.
This is the channel that the write half is currently working on.

register.description: The Memory Attribute register contains the attributes for all the 64K mapped regions. Offset = 10000h + (y * 4h); where y = 0h to 7Fh

bitfield.description: Defines the type of the memory
Defines the shareability domain of the memory
Defines the outer allocatability of the memory
Defines the inner allocatability of the memory

register.description: The Memory Attribute register contains the attributes for all the second 16M mapped regions. Offset = 20000h + (y * 4h); where y = 0h to 7FFh

bitfield.description: Defines the type of the memory
Defines the shareability domain of the memory
Defines the outer allocatability of the memory
Defines the inner allocatability of the memory

register.description: The Memory Attribute register contains the attributes for all the first 16M mapped regions. Offset = 30000h + (y * 4h); where y = 0h to 7Fh

bitfield.description: Defines the type of the memory
Defines the shareability domain of the memory
Defines the outer allocatability of the memory
Defines the inner allocatability of the memory

register.description: Channel Configuration Register. The Channel Configuration Register is used to initialize static mode settings for the DMA Channel. The register may only be written when the chanel is disable by setting to 0x0 the DRU_CHRT_CTL_j[31] ENABLE bit. Offset = 40000h + (j * 100h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: Pause on Error. This field controls what the channel will do if an error or exception occurs during a data transfer. This field is encoded as follows:0 = Channel will drop current work and move on1 = Channel will pause and wait for SW to investigate and un-pause the channel.
This field controls how the TR is received by the UTC.0 = The DRU_SUBMIT_WORD0_1_j_k to DRU_SUBMIT_WORD14_15_j_k registers must be written to submit it.1 = The TR will be received through PSI-L.

This field states the TR type that is being used along with CHAN_TYPE_OWNER field make up the 4-bit CHAN_TYPE for an UTC. The value of this is all zeroes to reflect that the UTC DRU only does TRs through pass-by value mechanisms.

register.description: The Output Event Steering Registers are used to specify a global event number to generate anytime the required event generation criteria specified in a TR are met. A single event with the event number set equal to the value in the corresponding register will be generated. This register is provided in order to allow security software to lock down which events in the global space any given channel/ thread is allowed to generate Offset = 40020h + (j * 100h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: This is the global event number to be generated.

register.description: Channel Static Scheduler Config Register Offset = 40060h + (j * 100h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: Thus is the queue number that is written

register.description: The channel realtime control register contains real-time cotrol and status information for the DMA Channel. The fields in this regsiter can be changed while the channel is in operation. Offset = 60000h + (j * 100h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: This field enables or disables the channel. Disabling a channel halts operation on the channel after the current block transfer is completed. Disabling a channel in the middle of a packet transfer may result in underflow conditions in the attached application block and data loss. This field will be cleared after a channel teardown is complete. This field is encoded as follows:0 = channel is disabled1 = channel is enabled
Channel teardown.Setting this bit will request the channel to be torn down. This field will remain set after a channel teardown is complete.

Channel pause.Setting this bit will request the channel to pause processing at the next packet boundary. This is a more graceful method of halting processing than disabling the channel as it will not allow any current packets to underflow.

register.description: The Software Trigger Register provides a mechanism by which software can directly trigger the channel in a secure way. Offset = 60008h + (j * 100h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: Trigger: writing this bit with a value of 1 will cause the trigger event to be sent to this channel. This will trigger Local Event
Trigger: writing this bit with a value of 1 will cause the trigger event to be sent to this channel. This will trigger Global Event 1
Trigger: writing this bit with a value of 1 will cause the trigger event to be sent to this channel. This will trigger Global Event 0

register.description: The channel status details Offset = 60010h + (j * 100h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: The command id of the TR that had an error.
The information of the type of status.
The type of error that occured. Submission Errors are not captured in this register

register.description: The channel count details Offset = 60018h + (j * 100h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: Value of outermost count when error occurred
Value of second outermost count when error occurred
The value of the second innermost count when error occurred
The value of the innermost count when error occurred

register.description: The first TR submission word Offset = 80000h + (j * 100h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: Lines in a transfer
Bytes in a transfer
Flags for the operation and type of descriptor

register.description: The second TR submission word Offset = 80008h + (j * 100h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: Source transfer address virtual or physical allowed

register.description: The third TR submission word Offset = 80010h + (j * 100h); where j = 0h to 1Fh

bitfield.description: The size of the 4th loop in the TR transfer
The size of the 3rd loop in the TR transfer
The first dimension width of the source data

bitfield.description: The third dimension width of the source data
The second dimension width of the source data

bitfield.description: The first dimension width of the destination data

bitfield.description: Destination transfer address virtual or physical allowed

bitfield.description: The third dimension width of the destination data
The second dimension width of the destination data

bitfield.description: The fourth count of the destination if different than the source

The second innermost count of the destination if different than the source
The innermost count of the destination if different than the source
